item.title: Bonus! Pastor Craig Opens Up About How He Wins the War in His Mind
item.description:
In this special episode, we get to sit down with Pastor Craig and talk about his new book and upcoming message series. In fact, this episode is the first part in the Winning the War in Your Mind miniseries from Pastor Craig, where we’ll discover how to change our thinking so that we can change our lives. The rest of the miniseries will be available exclusively on the You’ve Heard It Said podcast—Life.Church’s spiritual growth podcast for LifeGroups. Go to http://life.church/YHIS to subscribe on your favorite podcast platform.

ABOUT YOU'VE HEARD IT SAID

Want more meaningful conversations? We started this story-driven podcast to help LifeGroups and friends reclaim their time together. Listen before meeting, then do the important stuff together—talking about the episodes, praying, and making memories.

Join us for honest discussions about the things that matter to you, the struggles you’re facing, and the spiritual truths that can guide you to a deeper understanding of who God made you to be. 
Go to http://life.church/YHIS to subscribe on your favorite podcast platform.

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

item.title: How To Forgive Yourself
item.description:
Forgiving others is hard, but self-forgiveness can be even harder. God wants you to step out of the shame that holds you back and into the freedom He has for you. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see what can change when you choose to forgive yourself.

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

This week, we’re taking a look back at a message we think is just as impactful today as it was nearly two years ago. Check out the video for more!

item.title: Don’t Give Up - Greater Reward Part 3
item.description:
Now more than ever, we need a fresh start.

You could do what you’ve always done. Choose what you want now over what you want most. But there’s a Greater Reward waiting for you. Discover how to let go of the status quo and stay focused on who God says you are and what He wants for your life.

item.itunes:title: Don’t Give Up - Greater Reward Part 3
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Do you ever look at someone successful and wonder how they did it? Often, we’re tempted to think they just got lucky. But it’s not luck that determines the direction of our lives. It's the result of countless consistent, seemingly small decisions done over time. Don’t give up if it’s taking you longer than you thought to reach your goals. Join us for Week 3 of our message series, Greater Reward, to learn how to make decisions today that will give you the life God wants you to have.

item.itunes:title: Why Can’t I Change? - Greater Reward Part 2
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Do you ever wonder why you are trying to change, but can’t seem to make any real differences in your life? Whether it’s your marriage, faith, health, or something else entirely, maybe you haven’t been able to change because you’ve been trying too hard. Maybe it’s time to start training. Join us for week 2 of our message series, Greater Reward, to learn how to stop trying and start training.

item.title: Help! I’m Out of Control - Greater Reward Part 1
item.description:
Society often tells us that if we want something, we should be able to have it RIGHT NOW. But that’s not the way life usually works. Often, when we want something, we have to create and maintain the discipline to reach our goals. In week one of Greater Reward, we’ll learn how to build self-discipline to choose what we want most instead of what we want now.

ABOUT GREATER REWARD

Now more than ever, we need a fresh start.

You could do what you’ve always done. Choose what you want now over what you want most. But there’s a Greater Reward waiting for you. Discover how to let go of the status quo and stay focused on who God says you are and what He wants for your life.

Learn more about Greater Reward: https://www.life.church/greaterreward

Start the Greater Reward Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/reward

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. item.title: 3 Promises for 2021
item.description:
25 years ago, Pastor Craig Groeschel and his wife Amy launched Life.Church in a two-car garage in Edmond, Oklahoma. In the last two and a half decades, we’ve seen God do more than we could ask, think, or imagine through you—the people of this church. This entire weekend will be a celebration of all God has done through Life.Church in the past 25 years - and what He promises to do in the years to come.

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

item.title: God's Dream in Your Heart
item.description:
God has big plans for you. He plants big dreams in your heart—and they can bloom when the soil is fertile. Set your sights on what’s ahead and prepare your soul to chase new hopes and goals as we enter this year together. Join Pastor Joakim Lundqvist for a special message as we kick off 2021 focused on God’s big dreams for our lives.

WELCOME PASTOR JOAKIM LUNDQVIST

Pastor Joakim Lundqvist is Senior Pastor of Word of Life Church in Uppsala, Sweden, with 3,200 members and an international network including over 700 churches. Before stepping into the ministry of Senior Pastor at Word of Life, Pastor Joakim founded the Christian cross-denominational student organization New Generation in Sweden. His 30 years of experience in youth ministry shines through in his creative sermons, aiming to relate to every generation. 

He is married to Maria, who serves as Music Director at Word of Life, and they have two daughters, Evelina and Julia, who are also both involved in the church and ministry.

 

CONNECT WITH PASTOR JOAKIM

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/joakiml  

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/joakim.lundqvist  

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/joakimlundqvist

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

item.itunes:title: The Good Room with Michael Jr.
item.itunes:author: Michael Jr.
item.itunes:summary: When you’re pursuing your passion, there are three “P”s that matter most: your people, the problem, and your gift. (OK, so two “P”s and one “G.”) In between rapid-fire jokes and real-life stories, comedian Michael Jr. will explain how to find your life’s punchline and how to leave a legacy that makes a difference. We hope you’re ready to laugh.

(OK, so two “P”s and one “G.”) In between rapid-fire jokes and real-life stories, comedian Michael Jr. will explain how to find your life’s punchline and how to leave a legacy that makes a difference. We hope you’re ready to laugh.

item.itunes:title: When You’re Disappointed by God - Missing Peace Part 4
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever felt angry at God? Like His plans don’t match yours—or like He doesn’t even have a plan for you at all? Sometimes God interrupts our plans for His purpose. item.itunes:title: Why is God Making Me Wait? - Missing Peace Part 3
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever felt like you’re waiting on God? His timing might always be perfect, but from where we sit, it can also be frustrating. It can even feel like sometimes, He’s forgotten us. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will take a look at what happens when God’s timing makes us pause, reflect, and depend on Him.
item.itunes:subtitle: Have you ever felt like you’re waiting on God? His timing might always be perfect, but from where we sit, it can also be frustrating. It can even feel like sometimes, He’s forgotten us. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will take a look at what happens when God’s timing makes us pause, reflect, and depend on Him.

item.title: Help! These People Are Driving Me Crazy - Missing Peace Part 2
item.description:
Have you ever wished there was a manual for how to deal with difficult people? Jesus didn’t call us to be right, He called us to be loving. He called us to forgive. So while it’s easy to be offended by what we see in the world, we’re called to forgive. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a lesson in how to deal with difficult people in this message.

item.title: Has 2020 Knocked You Down?
item.description:
Alongside her husband Craig, Amy Groeschel co-founded Life.Church in 1996. As the leader of Sisters, the Life.Church women’s ministry, she authors Bible studies for women, including The Call, The Pursuit, and The Hope. She is also the founder and President of Branch15, a non-profit housing ministry supporting women on the path to recovery. Amy and Craig married in 1991 and have six children.

Connect with Pastor Amy on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/amygroeschel

Start the Rise Up and Stand Firm Bible Plan: https://www.go2.lc/riseup

item.content:encoded:
Alongside her husband Craig, Amy Groeschel co-founded Life.Church in 1996. As the leader of Sisters, the Life.Church women’s ministry, she authors Bible studies for women, including The Call, The Pursuit, and The Hope. She is also the founder and President of Branch15, a non-profit housing ministry supporting women on the path to recovery. Amy and Craig married in 1991 and have six children.

Connect with Pastor Amy on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/amygroeschel

item.itunes:summary: Sometimes, it’s hard to have faith, because the reality is this: life is unpredictable. But you were made to persevere, no matter the highs and lows. Join Pastor Amy Groeschel for this week’s message of hope and faith, and find out how to stand firm and rejoice through pain and uncertainty.

item.itunes:title: When Christians Get It Wrong: In God We Trust Part 4
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Grace and truth are the cornerstones of the Gospel and Christianity. But here’s some truth: Sometimes, Christians get it wrong. And here’s some grace: Falling short is okay when you know the Savior. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover why Christians can get it wrong, and what we can do to embrace the grace and truth that Christ offers to us.
item.itunes:subtitle: Grace and truth are the cornerstones of the Gospel and Christianity. But here’s some truth: Sometimes, Christians get it wrong. item.itunes:title: The Sermon I Didn't Want to Preach: In God We Trust Part 3
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Need some good news? In times of trouble God overflows with His exceedingly abundant protection, provision, and strength. Our God is big enough to oversee the whole world and loving enough to care about you. Be still and know that He is God. Take heart in this message of good news from Pastor Craig Groeschel.

item.itunes:title: Under the Influence: In God We Trust Part 2
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Are you under the influence of God or culture? When we lower our guard, it’s hard to know what’s influencing us—but whatever we allow to influence us, changes us. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel uses the biblical story of Daniel to illustrate how to stay under God’s influence when the world offers tempting alternatives to His righteousness.
item.itunes:subtitle: Are you under the influence of God or culture? When we lower our guard, it’s hard to know what’s influencing us—but whatever we allow to influence us, changes us. item.title: Can You Trust God? In God We Trust Part 1
item.description:
It’s hard to trust God when you don’t understand the plan, and even harder to surrender when you’re longing for control. But in the midst of the chaos, there’s a hope you can cling to. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel shares two prayers you can pray that will help you build your obedience to trust God and to surrender to Him what you cannot control.

ABOUT IN GOD WE TRUST

Pandemics. Politics. Social unrest. There’s no denying we’re in a season of conflict and chaos—but the noise in your news feed doesn’t have to pollute your soul. You can find peace. item.title: Make Miracles Happen - 21st Century Temples: Part 2
item.description:
WELCOME PASTOR JOAKIM LUNDQVIST

Pastor Joakim Lundqvist is Senior Pastor of Word of Life Church in Uppsala, Sweden, with 3,200 members and an international network including over 700 churches. Before stepping into the ministry of Senior Pastor at Word of Life, Pastor Joakim founded the Christian cross-denominational student organization New Generation in Sweden. His 30 years of experience in youth ministry shines through in his creative sermons, aiming to relate to every generation. 

He is married to Maria, who serves as Music Director at Word of Life, and they have two daughters, Evelina and Julia, who are also both involved in the church and ministry.

 

CONNECT WITH PASTOR JOAKIM

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/joakiml  

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/joakim.lundqvist  

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/joakimlundqvist  

ABOUT 21st CENTURY TEMPLES

Miracles beyond belief, truth pushing back fear and lies, answered prayers: They don’t just belong in stories from the past. They’re happening today—and they can happen through you, too. Learn more about this series: https://www.life.church/temples

LIFE.CHURCH LOCATIONS ARE OPEN

item.author: interactive@life.church (Sermon)
item.content:encoded:
WELCOME PASTOR JOAKIM LUNDQVIST

Pastor Joakim Lundqvist is Senior Pastor of Word of Life Church in Uppsala, Sweden, with 3,200 members and an international network including over 700 churches. Before stepping into the ministry of Senior Pastor at Word of Life, Pastor Joakim founded the Christian cross-denominational student organization New Generation in Sweden. His 30 years of experience in youth ministry shines through in his creative sermons, aiming to relate to every generation. 

He is married to Maria, who serves as Music Director at Word of Life, and they have two daughters, Evelina and Julia, who are also both involved in the church and ministry.

item.itunes:title: The Best of Life.Church: Part 4
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Take a fresh look at our favorite message series from the last few years at Life.Church with The Best Of! In this message from the Anxious for Nothing series, learn from the biblical figure Elijah how to avoid running yourself into the ground, shutting people out, focusing on the negative, and forgetting God in your anxiety. God speaks in the whispers: don’t be anxious for nothing when you’ve had enough!

item.itunes:title: Emotions, Part 4: Feeling Lost in Sadness? Experience Joy Again
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Jesus felt sadness—and he feels the sadness so many of us are feeling in the world right now. There’s one thing that brings Jesus sadness more than anything else, and it’s the same thing that keeps us from experiencing His joy. In this message, you’ll hear three ways you can experience joy with Jesus, and why it’s so much better being joyful together than feeling sadness alone.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus felt sadness—and he feels the sadness so many of us are feeling in the world right now. There’s one thing that brings Jesus sadness more than anything else, and it’s the same thing that keeps us from experiencing His joy. item.itunes:title: Emotions, Part 3: Angry Like Jesus
item.itunes:author: Sermon
item.itunes:summary: Jesus felt many emotions—and anger was one of them. But there are a few things we can learn about why Jesus got angry, and what He chose to do when He felt strong emotions. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a message about how when we focus our anger on the right things and channel our emotions the right way, we can start to unite a divided world.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus felt many emotions—and anger was one of them. But there are a few things we can learn about why Jesus got angry, and what He chose to do when He felt strong emotions. item.itunes:title: Emotions, Part 2: Finding Relief From Anxiety
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Jesus Himself needed anxiety relief. And when He despaired, He gave us the blueprint for how to deal with worry, stress, and fear. If you need anxiety relief, join Pastor Craig Groeschel and discover the three things Jesus leads us to do to find peace in our hearts and align the feelings we experience with a faith that never fails.

item.itunes:title: Emotions, Part 1: Where is God When You Hurt
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: When you’re grieving, when you’ve got hurt feelings, when you’re struggling, remember—Jesus hurt the same way you do. And He feels compassion for people who hurt. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel speaks to anyone feeling unsettled, depressed, anxious, or hopeless with a simple reminder: God sees you. Cast your hopes, your cares, and your hurt feelings on Him. He cares for you.
item.itunes:subtitle: When you’re grieving, when you’ve got hurt feelings, when you’re struggling, remember—Jesus hurt the same way you do. And He feels compassion for people who hurt. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel speaks to anyone feeling unsettled, depressed, anxious, or hopeless with a simple reminder: God sees you. Cast your hopes, your cares, and your hurt feelings on Him. He cares for you.

item.title: Don't Forget to Remember, Part 2: "Get Out"
item.description:
ABOUT PASTOR ROBERT MADU

Robert is passionately in love with Jesus. For 10 years he has crisscrossed the globe, preaching the Gospel and taking every opportunity to tell people about the love of Jesus Christ. Robert is compelled to make aware to every individual that God is for them and that He has a specific plan and purpose for every life. Robert serves on the teaching team at Trinity Church in Cedar Hill, TX. He and his wife Taylor have three children.

CONNECT WITH PASTOR ROBERT

Web: https://robertmadu.com/

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/robertmadu

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/robert.madu

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/robertmadu

ABOUT DON’T FORGET TO REMEMBER

Uncertainty can drive you to fear, worry, and doubt. But it’s also an invitation to hope. When you’re faced with something you can’t handle on your own, Don’t Forget to Remember who worked miracles in the past—and that He can do it again. Learn more about the Don’t Forget to Remember message series: https://www.life.church/dontforget  

REOPENING

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. item.itunes:author: Robert Madu
item.itunes:summary: If you’re feeling overwhelmed, you’re not alone. Jesus worked many miracles in the Bible—and yet his disciples still sometimes doubted Him. item.itunes:title: Called, Part 2: Reclaim Your Calling
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Wondering how to find your purpose? It's not always easy, and when you find it, it will probably be even tougher to live it out. The moment you step into your calling, you step out of your comfort zone. But when you're called to a purpose, backing down isn't an option. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover how reclaiming your calling may come at a cost—but it will also sustain you in the long run.

item.itunes:title: Called, Part 1: Is God Calling You?
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: When you think about your calling, you might think about what you’re called by God to do. But your purpose isn’t as much about what you’re doing as it is who you’re becoming. Being called by God means you’re set apart—but what is it that you’re set apart for? Join Pastor Craig Groeschel on a journey to find your purpose and understand who you God made you to be.
item.itunes:subtitle: When you think about your calling, you might think about what you’re called by God to do. But your purpose isn’t as much about what you’re doing as it is who you’re becoming. Being called by God means you’re set apart—but what is it that you’re set apart for? Join Pastor Craig Groeschel on a journey to find your purpose and understand who you God made you to be.

item.title: Step Out of Your Boat
item.description:
REOPENING

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more:: https://www.life.church/updates

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

WELCOME PASTOR JOAKIM LUNDQVIST

Pastor Joakim Lundqvist is Senior Pastor of Word of Life Church in Uppsala, Sweden, with 3,200 members and an international network including over 700 churches. Before stepping into the ministry of Senior Pastor at Word of Life, Pastor Joakim founded the Christian cross-denominational student organization New Generation in Sweden. His 30 years of experience in youth ministry shines through in his creative sermons, aiming to relate to every generation. 

He is married to Maria, who serves as Music Director at Word of Life, and they have two daughters, Evelina and Julia, who are also both involved in the church and ministry.

item.itunes:title: Step Out of Your Boat
item.itunes:author: Sermon
item.itunes:summary: The power of the Holy Spirit is strong. Don’t let thunderstorms and crashing waves around you keep you from what God has in store for you. Every day, you’re given chances to grow, to connect, and to make a difference. Are you ready to Step Out of Your Boat into something greater? Join Pastor Joakim Lundqvist to see how the Holy Spirit isn’t just preparing you for something incredible—the power of the Holy Spirit is preparing others for it, too.
item.itunes:subtitle: The power of the Holy Spirit is strong. Don’t let thunderstorms and crashing waves around you keep you from what God has in store for you. Every day, you’re given chances to grow, to connect, and to make a difference. Are you ready to Step Out of Your Boat into something greater? Join Pastor Joakim Lundqvist to see how the Holy Spirit isn’t just preparing you for something incredible—the power of the Holy Spirit is preparing others for it, too.

item.title: Stay Positive, Part 6: Ending the Scarcity Cycle
item.description:
REOPENING

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more:: https://www.life.church/updates

I’M GENEROUS

When you gave your life to God, you accepted the most generous gift of all. This four-day Bible Plan will help you discover the only rational response. Start reading the next Stay Positive Bible Plan, “I’m Generous”: https://www.go2.lc/staypositive

SUPPORT COVID-19 RESPONSE AND DIGITAL MISSIONS

You can designate a gift to Life.Church to go to coronavirus relief or to Digital Missions like the Church Online Platform! Your gift above the tithe helps meet immediate needs in your community and around the world and helps other churches to spread the Good News of Christ to people everywhere: https://www.life.church/giving

ABOUT STAY POSITIVE

There’s no limit on hope. You can discover a whole lot to smile about if you know where to look. And we can help you find it! Don’t let life get you down. Stay joyful. Stay hopeful. And Stay Positive! For more about this series, visit https://www.life.church/staypositive

STAY CONNECTED

Stay updated with the latest news from Life.Church at https://www.life.church/stayconnected. You can also visit https://www.life.church/updates for the latest, or download the Life.Church app (https://www.life.church/app) and enable push notifications.

item.title: God, Help Us Unite: Stop the Division
item.description:
ABOUT GOD, HELP US UNITE

When our world is divided and people are hurting, what’s our responsibility as followers of Christ? Where do we even start? Get next steps and follow-up resources for this series at https://go2.lc/stopracism

WANT TO KNOW WHAT THE BIBLE SAYS ABOUT RACIAL RECONCILIATION?

Check out these YouVersion Bible Plans:

-Tony Evans Explores Racial Reconciliation: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/20082-tony-evans-explores-racial-reconciliation

-Rev. Dr. Bernice A. King: Cultivating a Heart of Mercy: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/13890-bernice-king-cultivating-a-heart-of-mercy/

-Be The Bridge: By Latasha Morrison: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/16910-the-bridge-a-5-day-youversion-by-latasha-morrison/

-Patterns for Peace: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/17861-patterns-for-peace

MORE ON RACIAL RECONCILIATION:

-We Can Do Better to Stop Racism: https://finds.life.church/stop-racism/

-Racism is Real: https://finds.life.church/racism-real-martin-luther-king-jr-grandma/

-How I Learned to Live a Life That Matters from a Civil Rights Pioneer: https://finds.life.church/learned-live-life-matters-civil-rights-pioneer/

-Racism and the Heart of God: https://finds.life.church/racism-and-the-heart-of-god/

item.title: Stay Positive, Part 1: Enough of the Bad News
item.description:
REOPENING

Some Life.Church locations have resumed services. To ensure safety at our locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. To see if your location is open and to save your seat at an upcoming service, please visit https://www.life.church/updates

I’M OPTIMISTIC

Optimism doesn’t depend on what we see—it stems from what God says. This four-day Bible Plan unwraps eight reasons from Romans 8 to remain unwaveringly optimistic. Start reading part one of the six-part Stay Positive series: https://www.go2.lc/staypositive

SUPPORT COVID-19 RESPONSE AND DIGITAL MISSIONS

item.itunes:title: Stay Positive, Part 1: Enough of the Bad News
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Bad news seems to be everywhere you look these days. What consumes your mind controls your life—so who’s ready for some good news and positive thinking instead? In Week 1 of Stay Positive, join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover the hope you can have in Christ, the good news you need to hear, and how to stay optimistic even when bad news tries to dominate your daily life.
item.itunes:subtitle: Bad news seems to be everywhere you look these days. What consumes your mind controls your life—so who’s ready for some good news and positive thinking instead? In Week 1 of Stay Positive, join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover the hope you can have in Christ, the good news you need to hear, and how to stay optimistic even when bad news tries to dominate your daily life.

DO CHURCH AT HOME

Churches in many countries are suspending regular in-person gatherings, but that doesn’t mean church is canceled. As followers of Jesus, we are the Church. Use this guide on having church at home to stay connected to your community: https://finds.life.church/church-at-home-guide/

LIFE.CHURCH MIDWEEK 

Life.Church is hosting special midweek services with worship and a short devotional with Pastor Craig Groeschel here on YouTube Live every Wednesday. Subscribe to our channel and tap the bell icon to be notified when we’re going live!

item.itunes:title: There Is a Reason, Part 3: Stop Comparing Your Calling
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Your purpose is yours alone. God created you to live out your unique calling. No one else can do it for you. And you can’t live out anyone else’s. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see how when you start to compare your calling with someone else’s, you might find yourself disappointed, discouraged, or disillusioned with your life.
item.itunes:subtitle: Your purpose is yours alone. God created you to live out your unique calling. No one else can do it for you. And you can’t live out anyone else’s. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see how when you start to compare your calling with someone else’s, you might find yourself disappointed, discouraged, or disillusioned with your life.

item.itunes:title: There Is a Reason, Part 1: A Purpose in Your Pain
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: When we’re going through trials, it’s tempting to look at our lives with a perspective of pain. But there’s a purpose in your pain. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see how God never wastes a hurt, and how He’s preparing you for something far greater through the trials, struggles, and pain you’re experiencing now.

item.itunes:title: Easter at Life.Church: When Life Feels Out of Control
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary:
One church. Thousands of locations. Let's gather together in our homes to celebrate life in Christ this Easter.
As humans, we like to feel like we’re in control. We like to know what we can expect. But right now, we’re uncertain. We’re distant. Right now, life feels out of control. But maybe we never had it in the first place. In this special Easter message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will show you how we gain strength, peace, and courage when we surrender control of our lives to God. It won’t always be easy—but it will always be worth it.
item.itunes:subtitle:
One church. Thousands of locations. Let's gather together in our homes to celebrate life in Christ this Easter.
As humans, we like to feel like we’re in control. We like to know what we can expect. But right now, we’re uncertain. We’re distant. Right now, life feels out of control. But maybe we never had it in the first place. In this special Easter message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will show you how we gain strength, peace, and courage when we surrender control of our lives to God. It won’t always be easy—but it will always be worth it.

item.itunes:title: Not Afraid: When You Feel Anxious, Alone, and Afraid
item.itunes:author: Life.Church: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: It’s OK to feel emotional right now. Anxiety, fear, and isolation might be trying to take over your heart, but God’s Word tells us in James that when we draw near to God, He draws near to us. If you’re feeling anxious, alone, or afraid and need to feel God closer to you, this video is for you. Listen to this hope-filled message from Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover God’s faithfulness, unfailing love, and promises for the future.

You can also visit https://www.life.church/updates for the latest, or download the Life.Church app (https://www.life.church/app) and enable push notifications.

DO CHURCH AT HOME

Churches in many countries are suspending regular in-person gatherings, but that doesn’t mean church is canceled. As followers of Jesus, we are the Church. Use this guide on having church at home to stay connected to your community: https://finds.life.church/church-at-home-guide/

MIDWEEK WORSHIP

During at least the next few weeks, Life.Church will host special midweek services with worship and a short devotional with Pastor Craig Groeschel here on YouTube Live. Subscribe to our channel and tap the bell icon to be notified when we’re going live!

ABOUT NOT AFRAID

When our world is shaken, it’s easy for fear to spread. But God promises to be with us no matter what comes our way. In times of uncertainty, it’s more important than ever to trust who God is and how He says we can live—Not Afraid. More: https://www.life.church/media/messages/not-afraid

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Right now, we meet online every week at https://www.live.life.church. Find more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app. 

FIND US ON SOCIAL MEDIA

item.itunes:title: Not Afraid: Finding Hope in the Chaos
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: Hope is contagious. When the fear of the unknown spreads, our hope in Christ can spread even faster. Replace panic with peace. Replace anxiety with comfort. Replace the “what-ifs” with faith in what God can do. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a special message to see how, in the face of coronavirus fears and isolation, we can have a contagious hope that fights back the fear of the unknown.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hope is contagious. When the fear of the unknown spreads, our hope in Christ can spread even faster. Replace panic with peace. Replace anxiety with comfort. item.itunes:title: Not Afraid: How should the Church respond to coronavirus?
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary:
In the last two weeks Pastor Craig Groeschel has gained a unique perspective on the fear and anxiety related to the recent coronavirus outbreak. Hear what he's learned from his experience, and how God invites us to respond to the situation.
When our world is shaken, it’s easy for fear to spread. But God promises to be with us no matter what comes our way. In times of uncertainty, it’s more important than ever to trust who God is and how He says we can live—Not Afraid.
item.itunes:subtitle:
In the last two weeks Pastor Craig Groeschel has gained a unique perspective on the fear and anxiety related to the recent coronavirus outbreak. Hear what he's learned from his experience, and how God invites us to respond to the situation.
When our world is shaken, it’s easy for fear to spread. But God promises to be with us no matter what comes our way. In times of uncertainty, it’s more important than ever to trust who God is and how He says we can live—Not Afraid.

item.title: Dangerous Prayers, Part 3: The Most Dangerous Prayer: Break My Heart
item.description:
JOIN A LIFEGROUP

Find the community you’ve been looking for. Discover the prayer warriors waiting to stand with you. If you’re interested in joining or starting a LifeGroup, visit https://www.life.church/lifegroups.

 

PRAYERS FOR WHAT YOU NEED

Whether you’re new to prayer or have been praying your whole life, it can sometimes feel overwhelming figuring out where to begin. We’ve put together some resources that may help you discover why we pray, how you can pray, and some prayers for strength, hope, stress, and everything else you need. Read through our prayer guide, available here: https://finds.life.church/prayers-for-strength/

 

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

 

PRAY WITH FIRE

Prayer moves the heart of God, but some prayers move Him more than others do. Bold prayers, daring prayers—the kind of prayers that move you, too. If you’re ready to see God work in your life, praying safe won’t cut it. It’s time to pray Dangerous Prayers. Find more from our Dangerous Prayers series here: https://www.life.church/dangerousprayers

 

MORE FROM DANGEROUS PRAYERS

Find even more ways to strengthen your prayer life. You can check out Pastor Craig’s new book, Dangerous Prayers, available here: https://www.amazon.com/Dangerous-Prayers-Because-Following-Jesus/dp/0310343127   

 

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app. 

 

FIND US ON SOCIAL MEDIA

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/life.church

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/life.church

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/lifechurch

 

CONNECT WITH PASTOR CRAIG

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIIdiIO-Y20hRW9niR0CA8A

http://www.twitter.com/craiggroeschel

item.itunes:title: Dangerous Prayers, Part 3: The Most Dangerous Prayer: Break My Heart
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: The thought of asking God to break your heart might sound a bit dangerous—and that’s because it is. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel introduces a prayer meant to align your heart with God’s, so you can begin to live in His truth and righteousness. Find out why asking God to break your heart could change your life forever.
item.itunes:subtitle: The thought of asking God to break your heart might sound a bit dangerous—and that’s because it is. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel introduces a prayer meant to align your heart with God’s, so you can begin to live in His truth and righteousness. Find out why asking God to break your heart could change your life forever.

item.itunes:title: Dangerous Prayers, Part 2: Speak to Me
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: It’s hard to hear from God when you don’t know what to listen for, especially if you find yourself praying with caution. But He’s ready for you to give Him your boldest prayers, and wants you to understand what He has to say. In this message, join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover how to clear your mind and prepare your heart so you can be ready to hear from God.
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s hard to hear from God when you don’t know what to listen for, especially if you find yourself praying with caution. But He’s ready for you to give Him your boldest prayers, and wants you to understand what He has to say. In this message, join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover how to clear your mind and prepare your heart so you can be ready to hear from God.

item.itunes:title: Dangerous Prayers, Part 1: Prayer is Powerful: Make Me Bold
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: When you talk to God, are you boldly bringing Him powerful prayers or are you stuck in a rut of praying it safe? In this week's message, Pastor Craig Groeschel brings to light how to break common prayer habits and begin talking to God with confidence and courage. Find out how God empowers you to take hold of the bravery you need to renew your faith and start praying powerful prayers.
item.itunes:subtitle: When you talk to God, are you boldly bringing Him powerful prayers or are you stuck in a rut of praying it safe? In this week's message, Pastor Craig Groeschel brings to light how to break common prayer habits and begin talking to God with confidence and courage. item.title: Warrior, Part 4: What Every Warrior Needs to Hear
item.description:
MEN: JOIN OR LEAD A WARRIOR LIFEGROUP

Men: You don’t have to fight your battles alone. Life is better together! LifeGroups are a place to laugh, grow, and serve with friends. If you’re interested in a LifeGroup, head to https://www.life.church/lifegroups to get started.

LET PASTOR CRAIG LEAD YOUR LIFEGROUP

Going through Warrior with your men’s LifeGroup? Pastor Craig has created discussion videos you can use to spark conversation and grow closer together. Find them each week of the series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLXvTERtQ_HV95I1zWGNn02-92iCSQXOo8

WHAT ARE YOU FIGHTING FOR?

Defeat the fear that stares you down. Find purpose in your battles. Discover your God-given courage to become the Warrior He made you to be. Get more from the Warrior message series: https://www.life.church/warrior

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: http://www.life.church/next

Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. item.itunes:title: Warrior, Part 4: What Every Warrior Needs to Hear
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary: When you wrestle with letting go of the past, leaving behind the pain of rejection seems impossible. We’re all wounded warriors, and often those wounds were given by the people we love. But God wants to give you the freedom you’ve been looking for. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for this week’s message, and discover how you can finally let go of the past and step into the healing God has for you.

item.itunes:title: Warrior, Part 1: When It’s Time to Throw a Punch
item.itunes:author: Craig Groeschel
item.itunes:summary:
You’re a warrior. You’ve got something to fight for. You have someone to protect. You’ve got a kingdom to advance. You’ve got an enemy to conquer. When it’s time to throw a punch, what does a true warrior do? Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to gain wisdom and understanding from God’s Word as you fight your battles. You’re a warrior—it’s time to step into your calling.
MEN: JOIN OR LEAD A WARRIOR LIFEGROUP Men: You don’t have to fight your battles alone. Life is better together! LifeGroups are a place to laugh, grow, and serve with friends. If you’re interested in a LifeGroup. Head to https://www.life.church/lifegroups to get started.

item.title: You Got It - Pastor Tim Doremus
item.description:
When you have big goals, it’s difficult feeling like you can make a difference when you don’t think you have what it takes to reach them. But God has given you the gifts you need to make the dreams He’s given you a reality. Join Pastor Tim Doremus for this week’s message, and find out how when you’ve got God, you really can make a difference.

item.title: The Gift, Part 3: A King Like No Other
item.description:
Do you know Jesus from a distance, or do you know Jesus as king? He wants you to know Him on a personal level, and just how much His purpose has to do with you. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel in this Christmas message as he discusses a king like no other.

 

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: http://www.life.church/next

 

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app. 

 

ABOUT THE GIFT

We treasure hand-picked gifts from those we love. They’re valuable and important because they’re meant just for us. And one gift meant so much, it forever changed the course of history. The story of this gift is one worth sharing. Find related series, articles, discussion questions, and more: http://www.life.church/thegift

item.title: One Minute After You Die, Part 3: The Glory of Heaven
item.description:
The questions you have about life after death—Is there a heaven? Am I good enough? What if I’m not?—can leave you wondering, but they don’t mean you have to live in fear. Bring your questions and find out what happens One Minute After You Die.

item.title: Unashamed, Part 1: Unashamed
item.description:

item.title: Love Like You’ve Never Been Hurt, Part 1: Love Like You’ve Never Been Hurt

item.title: I Choose, Part 4: Important Over Urgent
item.description:
We are the result of our decisions. While we agonize over little things like what to wear and what to eat, are we glossing over the big choices? There might be more on the line than you thought when you say “I Choose.”


Hosted by Simplecast, an AdsWizz company. See pcm.adswizz.com for information about our collection and use of personal data for advertising.

item.title: How to Neighbor, Part 4: Loving The Lonely
item.description:
As the world grows more connected, our neighbors are closer than ever. But how close are we to our neighbors? You might not share a fence, but you can still share their burdens and joys. Now’s the time to show the world How to Neighbor.

item.title: The Time Is Now, Part 3: The Blessings of Obedience
item.description:
No matter how much we want one, there’s no blueprint for a perfect life. Feel like you’ve hit a wall? Don’t be discouraged. Maybe it’s just a part of what God wants to help you rebuild. The Time Is Now to lay the first brick on a new foundation.

item.title: I Deserve It, Part 4: I Deserve To Be Counted Out, But He Gave Me Another Chance
item.description:
How different would the world look if everyone got what they deserved? Would your salary be the same? What would our prisons look like? Would nice guys finish first or last? God knows what we deserve. See if that's what we get in I Deserve It.


Hosted by Simplecast, an AdsWizz company. See pcm.adswizz.com for information about our collection and use of personal data for advertising.

item.itunes:summary: Everything changed in a moment. When Jesus was born, He gave us the chance to be known, accepted, and forgiven. When we experience His love, we can’t help but Come to Worship.
item.itunes:subtitle: Everything changed in a moment. When Jesus was born, He gave us the chance to be known, accepted, and forgiven. When we experience His love, we can’t help but Come to Worship.

item.title: Unlikely, Part 1: The Story Of Mephibosheth
item.description:

item.title: Struggles, Part 5: Rest
item.description:
As you scroll through your day, does it feel like everyone else has it all together? Someone always has the best job, cutest kid, or happiest relationship. We're pressured to measure up to other people's status updates and left with more #struggles.


Hosted by Simplecast, an AdsWizz company. See pcm.adswizz.com for information about our collection and use of personal data for advertising.

What do you do to get through the day? We allow certain habits to help us deal with life, but sometimes the bad ones can become part of our identity in dangerous ways. It’s time to separate ourselves from our so-called Necessary Sins.


Hosted by Simplecast, an AdsWizz company. See pcm.adswizz.com for information about our collection and use of personal data for advertising.
item.author: interactive@life.church (Life.Church: Craig Groeschel)
